intro: Sitobolium cuneatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Linaceae, which includes other members such as flax and common nettle. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in spikes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks. Sitobolium cuneatum is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and historical use in traditional medicine.
